result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie A. Forward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie A. Forward in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions parties regarding additions or corrections to Revocation Packet. DEF and State: no additions or corrections.
State argues sentence. Asks court to consider what DOC recommends. Atty Petros argues sentence. Def addresses court. 
Court addresses def. Court imposes: Count 1: 30 days county jail with credit for 220 days time served.
 Civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
